results.title: A Watch on the southern sky
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Provides a brief history of astronomy and a look at constellations. The program then focuses on how to map the sky and determine the location of celestial objects as well as looking at the differences between stars in terms of magnitude, colour and position. Examines the Moon and its cycles, and the location of planets in the night sky.

results.title: A Warehouse for bodies
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, ONF | NFB and Allan Goldstein
results.brief_description: Life inside a prison in Canada, the Kingston Maximum Security Penitentiary, as seen by the guards and the inmates. Interviews with prisoners and guards paint a harsh picture. The day is punctuated with the sound of metal, and violence runs dangerously close to the surface. A useful film that explains the high degree of recidivism in a sub-culture that operates by a code of its own.

results.title: A War story
results.creator_credit: Anne Wheeler and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How little a list of casualties tells the real story of war. Based on the diaries of Canadian doctor Ben Wheeler during his internment in a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp during World War II, this feature docudrama is not a “war story” in the conventional sense of strategy and battles, but rather a glowing account of the spirit and its will to survive physical and mental suffering. Newsreel footage of the fall of Singapore (where Major Wheeler was captured) has been interwoven with dramatic reconstructions of scenes inside the mining camp. An important aspect of this docudrama is that it is seen through the eyes of Ben Wheeler’s daughter as she interviews, in a very moving way, survivors of the camps. (Awards: Edmonton; New York; Ghent.) Cast: Doug Bagot, Rodrigue Deschenes, David Edney, W. Forrest MacDonald, Cecil Grinstead, Doug Kier, Patrick McGuigan, Allan Stebbings, Dean Stoker, Frank Turner, Gerry Whelpton, Tom Whitton.

results.title: A Waltz through the hills
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Paul D. Barron, Roz Berrystone and Frank Arnold
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by G.M. Glaskin, this multi-award winning adventure is about two young children who, after their mother dies, decide to run-away to England to stay with their only surviving relatives to avoid being put in separate orphanages. The first stage of the journey involves walking 107 kilometres from an inland West Australian wheat belt town to perth. They are befriended by a young aboriginal man and his family, survive a bush-fire, eat off the land and eventually reach Perth to media and public acclaim.

results.title: A Wall of Silence
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, James Ricketson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Patricia Quinn-Boas who contracted spinal meningitis and is now almost completely deaf as a result. Editor, Sarah Bennett; camera, Tony Wilson.
